title: Rising Inflation Keeps Pressure on Fed to Frontload Rate Increases
sub_head: Federal Reserve officials have signaled they will raise interest rates at their March meeting
body:
The question facing Federal Reserve officials ahead of their policy meeting next month is no longer whether they will raise interest rates but rather by how much.
Another strong inflation report released Thursday is intensifying a debate inside the central bank over how to speed up a series of interest-rate increases this spring to ease surging prices and cool the economy, according to officialsâ€™ most recent public comments and interviews.
